content:
Nice clash, but this really needs at least one more test/val pair.
Validator 2 is currently the only test that has n>1 and gives 1 as the answer. It's hard under Fastest clash conditions to realise that when t="a" the answer is always 1. It would be good to add a test case that has n>1 and t="a". I ended up with 80% in my clash because I rushed a bit and saw I had 100% on tests with my code, but assumed the only way to get 1 was if n=1 and t="a".

I ended up coming first, 2 other players got 80% and the rest got zero. I think it would really help to add another test case. https://www.codingame.com/clashofcode/clash/report/3825886536ef80330627f20b4602eeeec83862f

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good exercice envolving a simple if elif else bloc and a basic arrangement with repetitions (k^n).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice work!

Nice puzzle. I was confused by the case t="a": Violet can do an infinite amount of replacements,  but it will alway give the same outcome. So I suggest to modify the goal to something like "... find the amount of UNIQUE outcome(s) if ..."
with this small modification, I'm ready to approve your contribution!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think it's a nice puzzle for a clash code, haven't seen something similar on codingame. A little too much hard coding and not that much thinking but overall a nice problem!

Goal section - some grammar fixes:
* candy => candies (paragraph 1)
* have => has (paragraph 2)
* outcome => outcomes (4 times)
* did => performs / carries out (paragraph 4)
* operation => operations (paragraph 4)

Input section
* Suggest to add "type {{a}}" in front of "candies".

Output section
* Please change "outcome" to "outcomes" (2 times).

Constraints section
* You may simplify ||[[t]]|| to length([[t]]), and remove "where ||t|| (etc)".

Cases
* Test 2 and Test 5 are the same. Please change them so that they are different.

Thanks.
Modified. But doesn't the word "possible" ensure this already?
I'm not sure the word "possible" suggest the unicity. But I'm not native speaker ;-) IMHO, using the word UNIQUE would have helped me to understand my error in test case 2 case

Goal section
* Please change "performed" to "performs".
* Please change "outcome" to "outcomes" (2 times).

Thanks.
